thread.title: Baby's astonishing arrival as she is delivered by dad on living room floor inside amniotic sac
thread.title_full: Baby's astonishing arrival as she is delivered by dad on living room floor inside amniotic sac

author: Katie Butler
title: Baby's astonishing arrival as she is delivered by dad on living room floor inside amniotic sac
text:
News Baby's astonishing arrival as she is delivered by dad on living room floor inside amniotic sac Dad Andrew Camac had to battle to break through the membrane after delivering his daughter at their home in Swinton Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Why this dad had such a unique and funny experience delivering his baby Share this video Get daily   
Baby Sophia Marie was born in possibly one of Britain's most astonishing births - arriving inside the amniotic sac after being delivered by her dad on the living room floor. 
After missing the birth of his son Andrew Camac was determined to be there for his daughter’s arrival - but he had never imagined it would be so dramatic. 
The 28-year-old returned home from work to find heavily pregnant partner Melissa Tildsley in so much pain she was unable to stand up and immediately called an ambulance. 
But because he could already see the baby’s head the call taker said there was no time to get paramedics to help. Andrew Camac, partner Melissa Tildsley and daughter Sofia Read More Jail for women who lied about a friend 'trying to kill her baby' on Facebook - after she dies of overdose 
Little Sophia Marie arrived just ten minutes later, as her older brother one-year-old Harrison and sister Millia, four, waited patiently upstairs. 
But unusually she was born inside the water sac - an occurrence that happens once in every 80,000 births - and Andrew then had to battle to break through the membrane before she could take her first breath. 
Andrew, who works at a video game shop, said: “It all happened so fast I don’t think I had time to think about it really." 
He rang 999 and explained to the ambulance operator what Melissa was going through at their home in Swinton , but was told he would have to deliver the baby himself. 
He encouraged Melissa to push and their daughter was born a few minutes later - just a few days before she was due. 
She had been born in the water sac so Andrew had to break it open himself. He then put her in a towel and tied the umbilical cord with a shoe lace until paramedics arrived. 
Andrew said: “She did say use a pin or anything sharp I had around, but at the time I didn’t have anything so I actually had to grab the sack, pinch it, turn and pull. Dad Andrew Camac with Sophia, Millie Camac, mum Melissa Tildsley and Harrison Camac Read More 
“It was a really weird slimy sensation and as it burst the water went everywhere.” 
Sophia Marie was born on February 1 at 6.45pm and weighed 6lbs and 3.5oz. 
Paramedics then arrived and they were taken to Bolton Hospital to ensure everything was ok. 
Melissa, 23, said: “I was very scared but it happened so quickly. I knew the baby was coming and had half joked he would have to deliver her. 
“He did so well, he acted really fast and did everything right. A lot of men would have freaked out but he was calm. I’m so proud of him, we all are.” 
Andrew was desperate to make sure he was at the birth of his daughter as he had missed out on seeing the birth of his son Harrison, now one, who had to be induced - then arrived suddenly in the middle of the night after his dad had been sent home from the wards. 
He added: “We definitely managed that this time, I won’t ever forget it.” Like us on Facebook
